document.docAuthor: Patello, Thyago J. C. & Ruiz, Gustavo R. S.
document.docTitle: Mago jurutiensis Patello & Ruiz, 2014, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the acutidens group of Mago (Araneae: Salticidae: Amycinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the acutidens group of Mago (Araneae: Salticidae: Amycinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype :
male from Beneficiamento, Juruti, Pará, Brazil (
2.507611 °S
56.177639 °W
),
8–12 .VIII. 2010
, B.V.B. Rodrigues, N.F. Lo-Man-Hung, N.C. Bastos & N. Abrahim ( MPEG 21032 ).
Paratypes :
one female with the same data as holotype ( MPEG 21043 ); one female with same data, except for
07.V. 2010
, N.C. Bastos ( MPEG 21029 ); one female with same data, except for
12 .VIII. 2010
, N.C. Bastos ( MPEG 21042 ).
Etymology. The epithet is a toponymic adjective and reffers to the place where specimens were found.

Diagnosis. Within the group, this species seems to be closely related to
M. acutidens Simon
by having median projections on both the prolateral and retrolateral sides of the embolus, but can be identified by the more developed apophyses (
Fig. 27
). Females of both these species have large, oblique copulation openings about twice the width of the copulation ducts (
Figs 25 –26, 28– 29
), but it is difficult to tell them apart. So far, the two species have not been found living at the same locality.

Description. Male ( holotype ):
Total length: 6.65 . Carapace 3.23 long, 2.42 wide and 1.90 high. Length of ocular quadrangle: 1.70 ; anterior eye row 2.23 wide, posterior 2.13 wide. Legs 3142 . Length of femur I: 2.11 ; II: 1.80 ; III: 2.42 ; IV: 2.28 ; patella+tibia I: 2.89 ; II: 2.32 ; III: 2.37 ; IV: 2.18 ; metatarsus+tarsus I: 1.71 ; II: 1.52 ; III: 2.28 ; IV: 2.23 .

Female ( paratype MPEG 21043 ).
Total length: 8.17 . Carapace 3.42 long, 2.56 wide and 1.75 high. Length of ocular quadrangle: 1.99 ; anterior eye row 2.28 wide, posterior 2.09 wide. Legs 3412 . Length of femur I: 1.94 ; II: 1.94 ; III: 2.51 ; IV: 1.99 ; patella+tibia I: 2.61 ; II: 2.32 ; III: 2.56 ; IV: 2.47 ; metatarsus+tarsus I: 1.66 ; II: 1.47 ; III: 2.18 ; IV: 2.13 .

Variation. Males (n= 10 ). Total length: 5.79–7.12 ; length of carapace: 2.85–3.51 ; length of leg I: 5.60–7.12 . Females (n= 10 ). Total length: 5.89–9.02 ; length of carapace: 3.13–3.80 ; length of leg I: 5.22–6.84 .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–6.
Mago jurutiensis
sp. nov.
1. male, dorsal view; 2. same, ventral view; 3. female, dorsal view; 4. male, lateral view; 5. same, anterior view; 6. same, detail of chelicerae. Scale bar (1–5) = 2 mm; (6) = 0.25 mm.
